item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Kate Park, Alyssa Stringer
item.description: A timeline of ChatGPT product updates and releases, starting with the latest, which we’ve been updating throughout the year.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer, Kate Park
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Multiple London councils report disruption amid ongoing cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Three London councils reported disruption, prompting officials to shut down phone lines and networks and activate emergency plans.

item.title: GM tech executive shakeup continues on software team
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Three of GM's top software executives have left the automaker in recent months, as the company moves to combine its disparate technology businesses.

item.title: Breaking down the boom in the Nordic’s startup ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: On this week’s Equity, we sat down with Dennis Green-Lieber, the founder of the AI company Propane, to talk about the booming success of the Nordic ecosystem.

item.title: Musk’s xAI to build small solar farm adjacent to Colossus data center
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The artificial intelligence company said it was working with a developer to build a solar farm on 88 acres next to its Memphis site. Given the proposed size, the solar farm would likely produce around 30 megawatts of electricity, only about 10% of the data center’s estimated power use.

item.title: Are you balding? There’s an AI for that
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: MyHair AI examines photos of the scalp to help diagnose hair loss and suggest scientifically validated clinics and treatments.

item.title: Bug in jury systems used by several US states exposed sensitive personal data
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: An easy-to-exploit vulnerability in a jury system made by Tyler Technologies exposed the personally identifiable data of jurors, including names, home addresses, emails, and phone numbers.

item.title: Onton raises $7.5M to expand its AI-powered shopping site beyond furniture
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Onton, which changed its name from Deft, is giving users an infinite canvas with AI-powered image generation to nudge them toward making quicker purchase decisions.

item.title: Uber and WeRide’s robotaxi service in Abu Dhabi is officially driverless
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The commercial robotaxi service launched last year. Now, the human safety operator is gone.

item.title: Why ‘hold forever’ investors are snapping up venture capital ‘zombies’
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: An investor explains the "buy, fix, and hold" model employed by Bending Spoons and similar companies that buy distressed startups.

item.title: YouTube is working on a feature that will fix the messy home feed
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: YouTube is experimenting with a new feature that allows users to customize their home feed.

item.title: Character AI will offer interactive ‘Stories’ to kids instead of open-ended chat
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The company announced last month that it would no longer allow minors to use its chat features.

item.title: ChatGPT’s voice mode is no longer a separate interface
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: ChatGPT now lets you use voice and text in the same screen, making conversations feel more natural as responses and visuals appear in real time.

item.title: Warner Music signs deal with AI music startup Suno, settles lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: WMG says artists and songwriters will have full control over whether and how their names, images, likenesses, voices, and compositions are used in new AI-generated music.

item.title: OpenAI and Perplexity are launching AI shopping assistants, but competing startups aren’t sweating it
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Startup founders building AI shopping tools think general-purpose models are too broad to deliver truly personalized shopping experiences.

item.title: Find Your Grind raises $5M to grow platform empowering students to explore unique career paths
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Nick Gross says that Find Your Grind gives students the tools to explore what careers are out there and what paths suit their strengths, interests, and visions for what they want their futures to look like.

item.title: Microsoft’s AI chatbot Copilot leaves WhatsApp on January 15
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: WhatsApp's new platform policies ban general-purpose AI chatbots like Copilot from using its service.

item.title: China’s Pony AI plans to triple global robotaxi fleet by the end of 2026
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The Chinese autonomous vehicle company Pony.ai has global ambitions and plans to build a 3,000-strong robotaxi fleet to meet them.

item.title: Fleet Space finds massive lithium deposit using AI and satellites
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The discovery suggests that a region in Quebec might hold even more lithium than originally suspected.
